org.netbeans.spi.debugger.jpda

Class SmartSteppingCallback.StopOrStep

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.netbeans.spi.debugger.jpda.SmartSteppingCallback.StopOrStep
  • Enclosing class:
    SmartSteppingCallback

    public static final class SmartSteppingCallback.StopOrStep
extends Object
    Information about a possibility to stop at the given location, or suggestion to perform a step. Used by SmartSteppingCallback.stopAt(org.netbeans.spi.debugger.ContextProvider, org.netbeans.api.debugger.jpda.CallStackFrame, org.netbeans.api.debugger.jpda.SmartSteppingFilter)
    Since:
    3.5

    • Method Summary

      Whether this is a possibility to stop.
      static SmartSteppingCallback.StopOrStep skip()
      Express the necessity to skip the given location, using whatever the default debugger action is at the moment.

    • Method Detail

      • stop

        public static SmartSteppingCallback.StopOrStep stop()
        Express the possibility to stop.
        Returns:
        information about a possibility to stop at the given location.

      • skip

        public static SmartSteppingCallback.StopOrStep skip()
        Express the necessity to skip the given location, using whatever the default debugger action is at the moment.
        Returns:
        information about the necessity to skip the given location.

      • step

        public static SmartSteppingCallback.StopOrStep step(int stepSize,
                                                    int stepDepth)
        Express the necessity to perform a step at the given location.
        Parameters:
        stepSize - the step size, one of #JPDAStep.STEP_LINE or #JPDAStep.STEP_MIN, or 0 for the default size.
        stepDepth - the step depth, one of #JPDAStep.STEP_INTO, #JPDAStep.STEP_OVER, #JPDAStep.STEP_OUT, or 0 for the default depth.
        Returns:
        the step information instance. throws IllegalArgumentException when the size or depth is wrong.

      • isStop

        public boolean isStop()
        Whether this is a possibility to stop. If yes, values of step size and step depth are irrelevant.
        Returns:
        true if it's possible to stop, false otherwise.

      • getStepSize

        public int getStepSize()
        Get the step size.
        Returns:
        One of #JPDAStep.STEP_LINE or #JPDAStep.STEP_MIN, or 0 for the default size.

      • getStepDepth

        public int getStepDepth()
        Get the step depth.
        Returns:
        One of #JPDAStep.STEP_INTO, #JPDAStep.STEP_OVER, #JPDAStep.STEP_OUT, or 0 for the default depth.
